intro: Onosma luquanensis, commonly known as the Luquan thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plant grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Onosma luquanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
